episodeTitle: Tyranny! The Rulers of Sabaody, The Celestial Dragons
description: The Straw Hats arrive at Sabaody Archipelago and witness the horrifying cruelty of the Celestial Dragons. When a runaway slave attempts to escape, his explosive collar detonates, and Saint Shalria callously shoots him while he's down. Hatchan desperately warns the crew that harming a World Noble would bring an admiral to the island.

events.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Sabaody Archipelago
events.description: The Thousand Sunny reaches the Sabaody Archipelago, a unique island made up of giant mangrove trees whose roots have grown above the water. The crew observes the island's distinctive soap bubbles floating everywhere.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of one of the most critical arcs in One Piece, where the Straw Hats will face their greatest challenge yet and be scattered across the world. The arrival at Sabaody sets the stage for major world-building revelations.

quotes.text: This is amazing! The whole island is covered in bubbles!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first reaction to seeing Sabaody Archipelago

events.title: Hatchan Warns About the Celestial Dragons
events.description: Hatchan explains to the Straw Hats about the World Nobles, also known as Celestial Dragons. He warns them that these descendants of the World Government's founders wear protective bubbles to avoid breathing the same air as commoners, and that harming one would bring a Marine Admiral to the island.
events.significance: This exposition introduces one of the series' most important antagonistic forces and establishes the extreme power imbalance in the One Piece world. It foreshadows the upcoming conflict and demonstrates the oppressive nature of the World Government.

quotes.text: Listen carefully! No matter what happens, you must never, ever raise a hand against the World Nobles! If you harm a Celestial Dragon, a Marine Admiral will come to this island!
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Hatchan's desperate warning about the consequences of attacking a World Noble

events.title: Devil Dias Attempts to Escape
events.description: A large, muscular man identified as Devil Dias, a former pirate captain with a 60,000,000 bounty, runs through the streets of Sabaody as a runaway slave. He desperately begs people to help him remove his explosive slave collar, explaining he just wants to see his family and baby son one more time.
events.significance: This tragic scene serves as the Straw Hats' brutal introduction to the reality of slavery in the One Piece world and the cruelty of the Celestial Dragons. It demonstrates the inhumanity of the World Noble system and sets up Luffy's character conflict.

quotes.text: Please, somebody help me! I need to get this collar off! My son was just a baby when I left... I just want to see my family one more time!
quotes.speaker: Devil Dias
quotes.context: Devil Dias begging for help to remove his slave collar before it explodes

events.title: Devil Dias's Slave Collar Explodes
events.description: Unable to remove the collar himself, Devil Dias attempts to break it off. The explosive collar detonates, severely injuring him. He collapses to the ground, gravely wounded but still alive.
events.significance: This shocking moment demonstrates the brutal reality of the slave system and the life-or-death control the Celestial Dragons have over their slaves. It shows how the system is designed to prevent escape through lethal force.

events.title: Saint Rosward and Saint Shalria Debut
events.description: Two Celestial Dragons, Saint Rosward and his daughter Saint Shalria, arrive at the scene riding on the backs of slaves. They wear the distinctive bubble helmets of World Nobles and are surrounded by an entourage. Everyone in the area immediately kneels in their presence.
events.significance: This is the first time the Straw Hats witness Celestial Dragons firsthand. The introduction of these characters establishes them as major antagonists and showcases the extreme class inequality in the One Piece world. Their arrival sets up one of the series' most iconic moments.

quotes.text: Everyone kneel! The World Nobles are passing through!
quotes.speaker: Bystander
quotes.context: Announcement as the Celestial Dragons arrive

events.title: Saint Shalria Shoots Devil Dias
events.description: Saint Shalria approaches the wounded Devil Dias and, without hesitation or remorse, shoots him with a pistol because he is 'useless' and 'unsightly.' She treats the act of killing a human being as casually as discarding trash.
events.significance: This moment crystallizes the absolute cruelty and lack of empathy of the Celestial Dragons. It serves as a major catalyst for Luffy's rage and tests his ability to restrain himself. This scene is pivotal in establishing the moral bankruptcy of the World Government's ruling class.

quotes.text: How unsightly. This slave is completely useless now.
quotes.speaker: Saint Shalria
quotes.context: Before shooting the wounded Devil Dias

events.title: Hatchan Stops Luffy from Attacking
events.description: Luffy, enraged by the senseless murder of Devil Dias, starts to move forward to confront the Celestial Dragons. Hatchan physically restrains him, desperately reminding him of the consequences - that attacking a World Noble would bring an Admiral to the island and endanger all of them.
events.significance: This demonstrates Luffy's strong moral code and his difficulty in ignoring injustice, even when it would be strategically wise to do so. It foreshadows the eventual confrontation between Luffy and the Celestial Dragons. Hatchan's intervention shows the impossible position the crew is in.

quotes.text: Luffy, no! You can't! Remember what I told you!
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Desperately trying to prevent Luffy from attacking the Celestial Dragons

events.title: Jean Bart Appears as Saint Rosward's Slave
events.description: Among Saint Rosward's slaves is Jean Bart, a large and imposing man who towers over others. He is introduced as part of Saint Rosward's collection of captured pirate captains, wearing a slave collar and being forced to carry the World Noble.
events.significance: Jean Bart's introduction establishes his character and sets up his eventual liberation by Trafalgar Law. His presence demonstrates that even powerful pirates can fall victim to the slave trade and reinforces the oppressive power of the Celestial Dragons.

events.title: Introduction to Sabaody's Dark Side
events.description: The episode reveals that Sabaody Archipelago, despite being close to Marine Headquarters, is a hub for slave traders, bounty hunters, and pirates. The island's lawless areas enable the illegal slave trade that supplies the Celestial Dragons.
events.significance: This world-building reveals the hypocrisy of the World Government - the island closest to their center of military power is also a center of human trafficking. It exposes the systemic corruption and the true nature of the world Luffy seeks to change.

quotes.text: Sabaody is crawling with slave traders, bounty hunters, and famous pirates. Even though it's right next to Marine Headquarters, the lawless areas make it perfect for the underground slave trade.
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Explaining the dangerous nature of Sabaody Archipelago

events.title: The Bubble Coating System Explained
events.description: Hatchan explains that they came to Sabaody to find someone who can coat the Thousand Sunny with a special resin bubble, which will allow the ship to dive underwater and reach Fish-Man Island 10,000 meters below the Red Line.
events.significance: This establishes the crew's mission on Sabaody and explains the unique technology that enables travel to Fish-Man Island. It sets up the technical requirements they need to fulfill before they can continue their journey.

quotes.text: Listen carefully! No matter what happens, you must never, ever raise a hand against the World Nobles! If you harm a Celestial Dragon, a Marine Admiral will come to this island!
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Warning the Straw Hats about the consequences of attacking Celestial Dragons

quotes.text: Please, somebody help me! I need to get this collar off! My son was just a baby when I left... I just want to see my family one more time!
quotes.speaker: Devil Dias
quotes.context: Desperately begging for help before his collar explodes

quotes.text: How unsightly. This slave is completely useless now.
quotes.speaker: Saint Shalria
quotes.context: Before callously shooting the wounded Devil Dias

themes.description: The episode starkly portrays the extreme class divide in the One Piece world, with the Celestial Dragons literally looking down on common people from atop their slaves. The requirement to kneel before them symbolizes the enforced hierarchy.
themes.symbolism: The bubble helmets worn by Celestial Dragons symbolize their separation from humanity and their belief that they are too superior to breathe the same air as commoners.

themes.description: The episode confronts the horror of slavery head-on, showing slaves treated as disposable property. Devil Dias's tragic attempt to escape and his murder demonstrate the dehumanization inherent in the system.
themes.symbolism: The explosive slave collars represent the life-or-death control masters have over slaves and the impossibility of escape within the system.

themes.description: Luffy faces a moral dilemma between his instinct to fight injustice and the tactical necessity of avoiding confrontation with the Celestial Dragons. His struggle represents the broader question of when to fight and when to retreat.
themes.symbolism: Hatchan physically restraining Luffy symbolizes the impossible choices faced by the oppressed - to resist and face overwhelming retaliation, or to endure injustice.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's sense of justice is severely tested as he witnesses brutal injustice but is forced to restrain himself. This builds tension for his eventual confrontation with the Celestial Dragons.
keyActions: Witnesses Devil Dias's desperation and death
Nearly attacks the Celestial Dragons in rage
Reluctantly restrains himself at Hatchan's urging
quotes: Luffy, no! You can't! Remember what I told you!

characterSpotlights.development: Hatchan demonstrates his knowledge of Sabaody and the dangers it presents. His desperate attempts to protect the Straw Hats show his loyalty and awareness of the consequences of confronting World Nobles.
keyActions: Warns the crew about Celestial Dragons
quotes: Listen carefully! No matter what happens, you must never, ever raise a hand against the World Nobles!

characterSpotlights.role: Tragic victim of the slave system
characterSpotlights.development: Through his brief appearance, Devil Dias represents the human cost of the Celestial Dragons' cruelty. His backstory of having a family and his desperate desire to see them humanizes the faceless victims of slavery.
keyActions: Runs through the streets begging for help
Attempts to remove his explosive collar
Dies at the hands of Saint Shalria
quotes: Please, somebody help me! I need to get this collar off! My son was just a baby when I left...

characterSpotlights.development: Saint Shalria is introduced as utterly devoid of empathy, treating human life as completely worthless. Her casual murder of Devil Dias establishes the Celestial Dragons as irredeemable antagonists.
keyActions: Arrives with her father on the backs of slaves
Shoots the wounded Devil Dias without hesitation
Treats murder as casually as disposing of trash
quotes: How unsightly. This slave is completely useless now.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several scenes showing the Straw Hats exploring Sabaody Archipelago and marveling at the bubbles, which were briefer in the manga.
The anime added more reaction shots of civilians kneeling before the Celestial Dragons to emphasize the fear and oppression.

trivia.fact: This episode marked FUNimation's first online simulcast broadcast, making it a historic moment for One Piece's international distribution.
The opening theme 'We Are! (2008 Remix)' by TVXQ was created to commemorate the One Piece anime's tenth anniversary.

sources.title: We Are!/Tohoshinki (2008) Remix - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Devil Dias was a pirate captain with a 60,000,000 bounty before being captured and enslaved by the Celestial Dragons, making him part of Saint Rosward's 'pirate captain collection.'
Sabaody Archipelago is unique among One Piece islands as it's not actually an island but a collection of mangrove tree roots that have grown above the water.
This episode corresponds to Chapter 497 of the manga, titled 'Adventure on the Archipelago of Dancing Soap Bubbles.'
